summary: Mend security vulnerability report for nyc-test-coverage package with 2 high-severity vulnerabilities in transitive dependencies: CVE-2023-45133 in @babel/traverse (CVSS 8.8) and CVE-2022-25883 in semver (CVSS 7.5). Issue was automatically closed as the vulnerable library was removed from the project inventory.
userImpact: Users could be exposed to arbitrary code execution during compilation when using affected Babel plugins, though actual impact depends on whether untrusted code is compiled.
rootCause: Vulnerable transitive dependencies (traverse-7.21.4 and semver-7.5.0) in the test coverage configuration package nyc-test-coverage-1.8.6.
proposedFix: Upgrade @babel/traverse to 7.23.2 or later, and semver to 7.5.2 or later.
workaround: Upgrade affected Babel-related packages to patched versions: @babel/plugin-transform-runtime v7.23.2, @babel/preset-env v7.23.2, or other affected packages listed in the vulnerability details.
resolutionDetails: Automatically closed by Mend as the vulnerable library was removed from the project or marked as ignored in the Mend inventory.
keyQuote: This issue was automatically closed by Mend because the vulnerable library in the specific branch(es) was either marked as ignored or it is no longer part of the Mend inventory.
